definitions.definition: (sometimes attributive) Something which supports.
definitions.example: Don't move that beam! It's a support for the whole platform.

definitions.definition: Financial or other help.
definitions.example: The government provides support to the arts in several ways.

definitions.definition: Answers to questions and resolution of problems regarding something sold.
definitions.example: Sure they sell the product, but do they provide support?

definitions.definition: In relation to a function, the set of points where the function is not zero, or the closure of that set.
(fuzzy set theory) A set whose elements are at least partially included in a given fuzzy set (i.e., whose grade of membership in that fuzzy set is strictly greater than zero).
definitions.example: If the membership function of a fuzzy set is continuous, then that fuzzy set's support is an open set.

definitions.definition: Evidence.
definitions.example: The new research provides further support for our theory.

definitions.definition: Compatibility and functionality for a given product or feature.
definitions.example: This game has no mouse support.

definitions.definition: An actor playing a subordinate part with a star.
An accompaniment in music.
(structural analysis) Horizontal, vertical or rotational support of structures: movable, hinged, fixed.
To keep from falling.
definitions.example: Don’t move that beam! It supports the whole platform.

definitions.definition: To answer questions and resolve problems regarding something sold.
definitions.example: Sure they sell the product, but do they support it?

definitions.definition: To back a cause, party, etc., mentally or with concrete aid.
definitions.example: I support France in the World Cup.

definitions.definition: To help, particularly financially.
definitions.example: The government supports the arts in several ways.

definitions.definition: To verify; to make good; to substantiate; to establish; to sustain.
definitions.example: The evidence will not support the statements or allegations.

definitions.definition: To serve, as in a customer-oriented mindset; to give support to.
definitions.example: I don't make decisions, but I support those who do.

definitions.definition: To be designed (said of machinery, electronics, or computers, or their parts, accessories, peripherals, or programming) to function compatibly with or provide the capacity for.
definitions.example: Early personal computers did not support voice-recognition hardware or software.

definitions.definition: To be accountable for, or involved with, but not responsible for.
definitions.example: I support the administrative activities of the executive branch of the organization.

definitions.definition: To endure without being overcome; bear; undergo; to tolerate.
To assume and carry successfully, as the part of an actor; to represent or act; to sustain.
definitions.example: to support the character of King Lear

definitions.definition: A position in which a gymnast is holding their body above the rings (or high bar, parallel bars...) usually with straight arms.
